question: In which of the following conditions, the domestic price a product will be equal to the world price in a country?
option1: trade restrictions are imposed on the product in that country
option2: the country chooses to import, but not export, the product
option3: the country chooses to export, but not import, the product
explanation: When a country allows free trade then the domestic price will be equal to the price elsewhere in the world. This is called a trade regime with no restrictions. In rest of the places, the prices will not be equal.
